// DEAD-END DIARIES

FEATURED — MONTH 06

This month's diarist: Linda from Procurement

1// linda_procurement_diary_june.txt
2// STATUS: still employed (unclear why)
3 
48:47am — Badge didn't scan on first try. Stood there
5  long enough to question every choice that led here.
68:51am — Coffee machine broken. Again. Taped sign says
7  "DO NOT UNPLUG." Nobody knows who wrote it.
89:02am — Opened 14 emails. Deleted 13. Replied to the
9  one about the fire drill with "acknowledged."
109:15am — Refilled paper tray in printer 3.
119:17am — Wondered if printer 3 has experienced more
12  of life than I have. It's seen every document.
1310:30am — Meeting about meetings. Brad said "circle
14  back" four times. I kept a tally on my notepad.
1511:45am — Found a Post-it in the supply closet that
16  just says "WHY." Didn't remove it. Felt seen.
1712:15pm — Ate lunch at desk. A crouton fell behind my
18  keyboard. I named it. We're friends now.
192:00pm — Procurement review. Approved 47 purchase
20  orders. None of them matter. All of them are urgent.
213:30pm — Someone microwaved fish. The Geneva Convention
22  should cover this.
234:47pm — Stared at the ceiling tile with the water
24  stain. It's getting bigger. Nobody else notices.
255:01pm — Left one minute late out of guilt. For what.

// OFFICE SUPPLY HAIKUS

Stapler is empty. I refill it every week. No one else will learn.
Yellow sticky note: "Remember to buy more pens." Written with last pen.
The clock reads four-ten. I've been here seven thousand days. It's been three years.
